page.title: 01An introduction to the area.
page.content: A peaceful,rural valley with only one major road,the{A59.}There are country lanes to scattered villages and tracks to halls of ancient families which are now working{farms. This particular area of the{Ribble {Valley}has a very small population.It has a greeness typical of England and especially of this part of Lancashire. It has been described as "The Gem of the North West" and is an area rich in the cultural and historic heritage of the past. {Tourism}is an industry of growing importance as is indicated by the many excellent places to eat and to stay. {Residents}of the three parishes of {Salesbury,Clayton-le-Dale}and{Copster {Green}usually work elsewhere.The{A59 connects with the M6 at Preston,and Blackburn's industrial areas are close at hand.
